description:
From Late Latin hippocampus, from Ancient Greek ἱππόκαμπος (hippókampos), from
ῐ̔́ππος (híppos, “horse”) +‎ κάμπος (kámpos, “sea-monster”). The anatomy sense is so named from its resemblance to the seahorse.

entries.meaning: (mythology) A mythological creature with the front head and forelimbs of a horse and the rear of a dolphin.
(neuroanatomy, anatomy) A part of the brain located inside the temporal lobe, consisting mainly of grey matter. It is a component of the limbic system and plays a role in memory and emotion.
